title: Oedipus Rex. No. 3. Man and god
creator_credit: Encyclopaedia Britannica Films, Massachusetts Council for the Humanities and John Barnes
brief_description: Explains that one philosophical message of “Oedipus Rex” is that man is subordinate to God. Shows how this theme is reinforced when Oedipus, representing the worldly liberal thought infusing Greek civilisation, is beaten by the gods. Suitable for upper secondary level.
